dict.string:
A jegyek már kaphatóak a Tixa és a Ticketportal rendszerében, valamint a Budapest Park kasszájában. Tixa link: http://tixa.hu/foals_budapestpark Ticketportal link: https://www.ticketportal.hu/event.aspx?ID=47803
▲ Early bird: 5999 FT ▲ 08.01-ig: 6999 Ft ▲ 08.02-től és a helyszínen: 7999 Ft ▲Terasz jegy: 14 999 Ft ➽ Terasz jeggyel jogosult vagy belépni a VIP bejáraton. A Teraszokról exkluzív helyről élvezheted a koncertet, és a koncertek utáni bulit.
A többi mint tíz éve ugyanazzal az öttagú felállással működő Foals a kétezres évek egyik legmeghatározóbb indie-zenekara, illetve legjobb példája annak, hogy a műfaj egyáltalán nincs leszállóágban, sőt. Tavaly megjelent negyedik stúdióalbumuk, a What Went Down egy egészen új szintre emelte a zenekart. Izgalmas visszatérésük tavaly kezdődött a lemez címadó dalával, de az igazi őrület a Mountain At My Gates című kislemezzel, és az ahhoz készült intertaktív GoPro-videóval vette kezdetét. Az augusztusi lemezmegjelenést egy meglepetés koncert előzte meg a Reading Fesztiválon, ami az NME szerint az egész esemény legjobb pillanata volt. Az albumot pedig remek fogadtatás jellemezte, a legfontosabb magazinok (Uncut, Mojo, NME, GQ) is elismerően nyilatkoztak róla, sőt, az idei NME Awardson el is hozhatták a Legjobb Album díját. A többször a világ legjobb koncertzenekarának választott Foals tehát karrierjének csúcsán látogat újból hazánkba, hogy két fesztiválos fellépése után végre önálló koncerten mutathassa meg, valóban érdemes a címre. Találkozunk augusztus 17-én a Budapest Parkban! ________________________________________________
jegyértékesítő helyek: ▲ Online jegyértékesítés: http://tixa.hu/foals_budapestpark ▲ Budapest Park jegypénztár: Soroksári út 60. 13.00-20.00 ▲ Jegyirodai értékesítés: https://www.ticketportal.hu/selling_places.aspx#20
jegyinformáció: ▲ Felelősséget csak a Budapest Parktól, vagy hivatalos partnereinktől (tixa.hu, ticketportal.hu) vásárolt jegyekért tudunk vállalni. ▲ A jegyedet ne tedd közzé semmilyen felületen
korhatár a koncertekre: ▲ 18 éven aluliak csak szülői kísérettel vehetnek részt a koncerten, kivéve 14-17 év közöttiek a Safe and Sound Mentori Program keretében (www.safeandsound.hu) ▲ 10 éves korig a belépés ingyenes
Telekom VOLT Fesztivál 2016 #VOLT2016 2016. június 29 - július 2. www.volt.hu www.voltfest.com

The USC Viterbi School of Engineering celebrates the GamePipe Laboratory’s Spring Showcase on Wednesday the 11th of May 2016, 11am to 2pm Shown at that event will be games & technologies built in classes held in the GamePipe Laboratory Spring semester, including work from the mobile, networked AI, immersive, engines & advanced games courses.
Register Here https://www.eventbrite.com/e/usc-gamepipe-showcase-tickets-21432530275?aff=efbnreg
Parking & Directions Directions to the USC GamePipe Laboratory are here. We have reserved 40 spaces in Lot 29B, which is enterable from W 27th St at the bend with University Avenue. We have reserved an additional 40 spaces in the John Tracy Clinic immediately next door to the USC GamePipe Laboratory. The John Tracy Clinic parking lot entrance is 806 West Adams Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90007. The JTC Gate code is 5241 ENTER. Please park in the spaces immediately next to the USC GamePipe Laboratory, 746 West Adams Blvd. Please consider taking the Metro or Uber to our event!

IncubateUSC & Blackstone Launchpad in partnership with The Greif Center, Spark SC, LavaLab, 3D4E, and Sigma Eta Pi present our end of year party with so many things to celebrate.
One party. You choose what you want to celebrate:
1) We're MOVING next year! 2) It's the end of the school year! 3) Happy Graduation Seniors! 4) A baby shower for James Bottom! 5) Silicon Valley Season 3 Viewing!
There will of course be food, beverages, and desserts; cool people, startup mingling, and networking.
Special Note: We're moving next fall - When you come back after the summer come find us at our new home in the Marshall Basement of Bridge Hall, we're taking over the Entrepreneur School Space.
We'll still be the same BLP & IncubateUSC you know and love, but with MORE SPACE to mentor student ventures, host events, and house all your favorite startup oriented student orgs.
Launchapalooza End of Year Celebration & Moving Party

Game demos? FREE Chick-fil-A? Tech talks? You name it, we've got it! Come out this Wednesday for our Greenlight Games Demo Day, an open-floor expo where you'll get to meet the creators of some of USC's best video games and play them for yourself!
Come at 5:50PM to meet the Head of EA (DICE LA), and Producer of Battelfield 3 and 4, as he presents at 6PM on how technology has shaped the gaming industry, EA's development, and Battlefield 4, with GAME DEMOS to follow from USC's very own Advanced Games Program!
Featuring:
A keynote presentation by Fredrik Loving, Head of DICE LA
Magnus: http://magnusarena.com Chambara: http://chambaragame.com Swarm: http://swarmmoba.com Sundown: http://sundown-game.com I.C.U. (trailer): http://tinyurl.com/ICUtrailer
Did I mention we have FREE Chik-fil-A?
See you all there!
Hosted by: Spark SC and TechLA Internships
TechLA Game Demo Day: Featuring Fredrik Loving (EA/DICE LA)

VRSC is proud to present its 1st annual Virtual Reality Festival and Demo Day! Come demo the best VR projects from students around Southern California as they compete for a variety of prizes Sponsored by Disney up to $3,000! The Festival will also include panels from leaders throughout the VR industry and demos of the latest and greatest work from top VR companies. View the schedule of panels below and check out the demo booths at any time throughout the festival!
THIS EVENT IS FREE AND OPEN TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC. NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED
Student Festival Submission Categories: -360 Live Action Video -360 Animation -Interactive Virtual Reality Game -Augmented Reality -Immersive Technology
Location: USC School of Cinematic Arts Courtyard, SCA & SCI Building Lobbies
Schedule 10:00 AM: Start of Festival - Exhibitor booths (students and companies) begin showcasing work.
10:00AM: Panel 1: "VR Digital Content Strategy and Monetization" w/ panelists Nicolas Alparaz (Feldspar Ventures); Brian Anderson (Harper Partners); James Creech (Bent Pixels); Chadwick Turner (Circle VR); Moderator Luke Wang
11:00AM: Panel 2: "The VR/AR Landscape" w/ panelists Eric Hanson (xRez), Max Planck (Oculus Story Studio), Eric Furie (USC Mocap), Ben Conway (VNTANA)
12:00PM: Panel 3: "Welcome To A New World Of Storytelling" w/ Interlude Ltd.
1:00PM: Panel 4: VR Film: “Marriage Equality VR” w/ Celine Tricart, Filmmaker (Lucid Dreams Productions)
2:00PM: DISNEY SPONSORED KEYNOTE with Ben Havey
3:00PM: Panel in SCA Gallery: Seed & Spark - Crowdfunding/Marketing: Gerry Maravilla
3:15PM-4:10PM: Judges convene privately to decide on student winners
4:20PM: Student VR Festival Award Ceremony in SCA Gallery: Student Awards Given & Kickstarter Announced
5:15PM: Closing Remarks in SCA Gallery
USC School of Cinematic Arts SCA Lobby & SCI Lobby

Come one, come all to the weekly USC Stand Up show!
Hosted by Rick Cisario, the show features 6 USC comedians doing 7 minute sets.
We will be performing in front of the stairs at the Ronald Tutor Campus Center.
Come on out and support your fellow stand ups.
Ronald Tutor Campus Center (TCC) 3607 Trousdale Pky

The 8th annual LA Beer Festival follows last year's sold out event, and this year's promises to be even better. The event will feature dozens of international and domestic beers, over a dozen food trucks (food sold separately) as well as live entertainment.
The 2016 LA Beer Festival will take place at LA Center Studios Studios from noon to 3pm and 5pm to 8pm. Admission is for only one session so make sure to coordinate with friends before buying your ticket.
The LA Beer Festival's proceeds will benefit Noah's B-ark, Inc (tax ID 95-4677862) whose aim is to rescue dogs from shelters and find permanent homes for rescued pets. Proceeds from the event will towards funding food, shelter, and veterinary bills for rescued pets.
For more info and to purchase tickets, go to http://www.drinkeatplay.com/labeerfest/

What is the Festival of Books? The Los Angeles Times Festival of Books began in 1996 with a simple goal: to bring together the people who create books with the people who love to read them. The festival was an immediate success and has evolved to include live bands, poetry readings, chef demos, cultural entertainment and artists creating their work on-site. There’s also a photography exhibit, film screenings followed by Q&A’s and discussion panels on some of today’s hottest topics.
Where is it? On the USC campus.
Who attends the festival? The festival attracts approximately 150,000 people each year of all ages from Southern California and even other parts of the country.
Los Angeles Times Festival of Books #Bookfest 2016

USC CONCERTS IS PROUD TO PRESENT SPRINGFEST 2016. ARE YOU READY TO GET GROOVY, ‘SC?!?!?!
Join us for our signature full-day music festival with your favorite acts, sick vendors, and some dank #eeeeeeats. You’re NOT gonna want to miss this one!
In conjunction with USG Program Board, USC Undergraduate Student Government, USC Graduate Student Government, USC Environmental Student Assembly, USC Special Events Committee, and USC Trojan Pride!
---------
SET TIMES:
• Jamie xx 10:30-11:45PM • Jeremih Official: 8:45-9:45PM • The Internet: 7:20-8:20PM • Andra Day: 5:55-6:55PM • Cozz: 4:45-5:30PM • Big Wild: 3:50-4:20PM • PJ: 2:55-3:25PM • Kid Cadaver: 2:00-2:30PM
---------
Don't forget to check out our GREENHAÜS side stage housed in a truly rad geodesic dome ~
GREENHAÜS LINE UP Guided Meditation with BreatheSC // 2:00 PM Geodesic Yoga // 2:55 PM Jynjo DJ Set // 3:25 PM Virtual Reality Panel // 3:50 PM SANTI DJ Set // 4:20 PM Environmental Entrepreneurs Panel // 4:45 PM Matt DiMona DJ Set // 5:30 PM Yoga of Bass: Music Ecstasy and Freedom // 6:00 PM Massi DJ Set // 7:00 PM Bianca Lexis DJ Set // 7:45 PM Ulf Bonde + Matt Ossentjuk B2B // 8:30 PM
---------
FOOD TRUCKS: The Boba Truck Border Grill Truck & Catering Jogasaki Sushiburrito The Grilled Cheese Truck King Kone
---------
DETAILS:
When is Springfest? Saturday, April 2, 2016.
What time does Springfest start? McCarthy Quad opens at 1:45pm, Vendors open for business at 2:00pm, and the first act begins at approx. 2:00pm.
What time does Springfest 2016 end? Approximately 11:30pm
Should I bring my ID? Yes, USC student ID is required to enter the Quad from student entrances
May I bring a guest to the concert? Absolutely! Each student is allowed to bring one (1) guest. Guests are welcome with a government-issued ID and will be provided a wristband for re-entry. However, all guests must enter through one of two designated entrances next to VKC.
When should I arrive? If you want to get a great view of the show and grab some food before it begins, arrive early!
Will there be food at Springfest 2016? Yes, Springfest will feature a variety of food trucks.
Am I permitted to enter and exit McCarthy Quad during Springfest 2016? Yes. To re-enter, students must show ID, and guests must show wristbands.
What is prohibited to bring into McCarthy Quad? NO drugs/paraphernalia or alcohol of any kind NO weapons of any kind NO loud noisemakers of any kind NO professional cameras, video cameras, or audio recording devices NO chairs of any kind NO laser pointers NO backpacks or large purses/bags of any kind NO skateboards or bicycles NO outside food of any kind NO outside drinks or containers holding liquid of any kind NO drones or selfie sticks

Tonight, we're visiting VR's not-so-distant cousin, AR, or Augmented Reality! VRSC E-Board member, Serhan Ulkumen, will be running a short tutorial alongside our friends at THE HEAVY PROJects, a company who develop creative and provocative deployments for emerging technologies that challenge existing styles of interaction, design, art and modes of thinking. Founder BC Heavy Biermann will be sharing the experience from his interdisciplinary background that comprises technology, philosophy, and the arts. He has worked as both a university professor and a tech developer. Afterward, there will be pizza, as always, so come on by to learn about Augmented Reality, Emerging Technologies and ask relevant questions
If you need lift out to GamePipe, here's how to get a free ride from Uber! 1. Download the Uber App on your phone. Make sure you are registered with your USC email address. 2. Enter the promo code USC2016SPRING into the Promotions section of your Uber app. This will unlock the USC button on your Uber app. 3. Request a free ride to Gamepipe from anywhere around the USC campus! Request another ride to get home safely.
NOTE: The USC Uber button is only available from 7PM to 2AM!
VRSC Dev Night! Augmented Reality Workshop with Heavy Projects!

LAST YEAR WE SHUT DOWN THE WHOLE BLOCK CAUSE WE WERE NOT RDY TO TURN DOWN AFTER SPRING BREAK.... CONTINUE THE LEGACY... LET MENLO RAGE ON
THIS YEAR WE'RE DOING IT BIGGER!! LIVE MUSIC, 2 DJs and a FOOD TRUCK
LIVE MUSIC STARTS AT 8 PM SO COME EARLY!
>>Girls FREE ENTRY before 9 PM
>>LIVE MUSIC: -Sam Alley (https://soundcloud.com/samalleyband) -Lauren Nikohl (https://www.facebook.com/LaurenNikohl/) -Gypsy Jazz: Atriya Wadhani & Mike Barr
>>DJ's (via Kaleidoscope Productions): DJ Muckmouth (https://soundcloud.com/halstoniscool) DJ Zereticz (https://soundcloud.com/zereticz)
>>Food Truck: The Super Smash Buns Food Truck will be there!
>>18 to Enter >>21+ to Drink
>>Super refreshing BEER & LIQUOR WILL BE PROVIDED with your lovely $5 donation. No USC ID required. Outside alcohol is welcome and might be the way to go if you're showing up super late.
Like Sam Alley's page to keep up with future parties. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ We will post and update accordingly. Stay tuned!

The Set Shop is having a Vintage Clothing Sale on Saturday March 26 11am-5pm. This is a FREE EVENT! Featuring Women's and Men's authentic vintage clothing and accessories from 1900 - 1970. Ice cream treats and hot dogs by C. k. Farnsworth's Mobile Soda Shop. Over 20 different invited vendors. Vendor list is closed. Please no dogs or scooters allowed inside. NO EARLY BUYERS Vendors: Charlotte Del Rose & Vanessa Ramsey Smokin' Gun Vintage/Christina Coffey Kitty & Teresa Wyman Reese's Pieces/ Benny Reese Tony Mercuro Santa Muerte Trading Co/Cyrstal Landeros All The ShinyThings/Jessica Hojo Jae Barnes Barbara & Martin Valadez J Patrick Platter & Lauren Stanley Gold Rush Vintage/Maggie Martinez & Isis Zepeda Gloria Perez Audra Lane & Connie Love Victoria Inez Rivera & Ernie Vargas Amanda Shaffer Paul Greenwood Monsivais & Co/Damian Monsivais Kyle & Holly Ellison Debbie Kellaway Dr. Rubin's Pomade Linda Brennerman Marc Chevalier

USC VSI^2 Venture Incubation Program is proud to present Matt Turner, CTO of Science Mobile. Turner is coming to speak on how to scale both the technical and business side of startups. We look forward to seeing you there!
Matt Turner
Matt Turner joined Science Mobile from Speek which was acquired by Jive Communications in June of 2015. During his time at Speek as CTO and Head of Product, Speek was named Wall Street Journal’s Top 25 Startups of the Year", Entrepreneur Magazine's "100 Most Brilliant Companies" for 2013, and PC Mag's "100 Top Websites of 2013”.
Speek was built to provide super simple conference calls and screen sharing from your mobile phone or desktop without a series of painful downloads. As a part of our Speek’s development Matt lead the architecture of the patented voice and web platform along with native apps for iPhone, Android, Blackberry, and Windows Phone.
As part of the core executive and management team Matt worked to raise $5.5 million in Seed and Series A funding. He also led the international expansion into over 50 countries and established strategic partnerships with Microsoft, Dell, Blackberry, Tempo ( acquired by Salesforce ), and LogMeIn.
Scaling Technology and Business w/ Matt Turner

We’re excited to announce our second speaker in our new #OnTheDL Series — Jerome Lacote! Lacote is a veteran designer with a variety of professional experiences, including UI/UX design for Rockstar Games and Activision.
Lacote will recount his experiences in the field, give advice on designing user experiences for digital products and services, and discuss the future of UI/UX in the context of virtual and augmented reality.
This session is a part of our #OnTheDL Series -- a series of lectures led by creative professionals and hosted in the Digital Lounge.
Seating is on a first-come, first-served basis (with priority given to Annenberg students) in ANN 301D
Event Sponsored by Adobe
Going VR: The Future of User Interface Technology

Beyond Wonderland returns to Southern California Friday, March 18, and Saturday, March 19, 2016, at the San Manuel Amphitheater & Grounds in San Bernardino, CA. There, Headliners will be swept away into a beautiful dreamscape of incredible music across four stages, interactive art installations, roaming performers and much, much more.
Headliners can once again sleep under the stars and join the enthusiastic community of the expanded Beyond Wonderland camping every night after the festival. The campground will feature decorated grassy fields and day and night entertainment, from morning yoga sessions to Silent Disco parties until sunrise. Tent, car and RV camping spots will be available, as well as turnkey camping options, including safari-style tents, fully furnished accommodations, memory foam beds and more.
“These Wonderland events were born and raised in Southern California, and so much of their unique style is inspired by the Headliners who attend them,” said Pasquale Rotella, Founder and CEO of Insomniac. “The magical spirit of our Headliners continues to make Beyond Wonderland a special experience.”
For more info, please check beyondwonderland.com.
✨Tickets are on sale NOW! ➙ insom.co/BeyondSoCalTix ✨

If you're struggling with using LinkedIn as an engineer, come learn from our LinkedIn Campus Editor how to leverage the profile as a Viterbi student. Learn to create a profile and network dedicated to your specific needs and technical skills.
To stay up to date on LinkedIn opportunities at USC, join the Campus Editor Newsletter at this link! http://eepurl.com/bMX18T
LinkedIn for Engineers: Get Recruited by Top Companies

We are pleased to invite you to attend the USC Career Israel fair. TAMID Group at USC in partnership with the USC Hillel Foundation on campus are hosting an Israel career fair with the mission of helping students get summer internships or fulltime jobs and exposing more students to the Israeli economy.
We have a great list of companies signed up! They will be recruiting for students with all types of backgrounds and degrees and will have opportunities based in the U.S., as well as in Israel.
This event was brought to you by: Hasbara Fellowships & The David Project

Join Angelenos beneath Chinese lanterns in the vibrance of Downtown L.A. for the 15th Annual Los Angeles Lantern Festival. Our FREE signature event culminates the Lunar New Year festivities with engaging community booths, museum tours, live entertainment, music, arts & crafts, and food trucks.
A hugely popular Chinese festival around the world, Lantern Festival occurs annually on the fifteenth day of the first lunar month to mark the closing of Chinese New Year festivities. CAM’s annual Los Angeles Lantern Festival represents a departure from most other commercially-based street event celebrations, with its primary focus on community building and education.
Please visit www.camla.org/LALanternFestival for more information. Event will be held rain or shine.
Note: LA County Ordinance prohibits the use and release of sky lanterns with open flames. We are currently working with the venue to hang as many lanterns as possible for the Lantern Festival event.

We are hosting a mobile-focused hackathon! Come build an iOS or Android app with us! If you've always wanted to go to a hackathon or build a mobile app but didn't know where to start, then this is the perfect event for you. We will provide every meal during the hackathon, that's right FREE FOOD! We'll have an Internet of Things (IoT) workshop prior the event and there will be an Android workshop and Ticketmaster API workshop during the hackathon for those who want to learn how to get started and could use a little guidance. We will also have mentors at the event who can help you get going on your project. We'll have a few iOS specific mentors too, so don't worry if you were looking to do an iOS app and need some guidance.
We'll have industry judges and prizes for the 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place teams! Additionally, Ticketmaster will have a prize for the best hack using their API!
In short: 26 hours, free food and drinks, awesome workshops to prepare for event, and great prizes!
Be sure to register on the Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/acm-mobile-hackathon-spring-2016-tickets-21839696119
Only USC students can participate.

REGISTER HERE for the online resume drop: http://bit.ly/1UltR2K It's free, easy, and takes less than a minute!
Small Companies, Big Opportunities. http://startupcareerfair.sparksc.org/
INFO: · 19+ Los Angeles Startups · Full-Time and Internship Positions · ENGINEERING, DESIGN, MARKETING, BUSINESS, COMMUNICATIONS, FILM · March 1st, 10 AM – 2 PM in the Engineering Quad at USC
COMPANIES: · Naritiv - https://naritiv.com/ · Jaunt Virtual Reality - http://www.jauntvr.com/ · Tiger Text - http://www.tigertext.com/ · Patient Pop - https://www.patientpop.com/ · ZipRecruiter - https://www.ziprecruiter.com/ · Iris TV - http://www.iris.tv/ · FreedomPop - http://www.freedompop.com/ · DealFlicks - https://www.dealflicks.com/ · MobCrush - https://www.mobcrush.com/ · Chef'D- http://www.chefd.com/ · Soothe - https://www.soothe.com/ · SteelHouse - http://www.steelhouse.com/ · Saucey - https://sauceyapp.com/ · Shoes of Prey - https://www.shoesofprey.com/ · ShowGo - https://www.getshowgo.com · Shadow Bid - www.shadowbid.com · Docket - http://www.docketcalendar.com/ AND MORE!
Our mission is to connect talent on campus (that’s you!) with the HOTTEST startups in Los Angeles. Students will have the opportunity to engage in informative discussion with recruiters, and apply for both full-time and internship positions. We’ll also be showcasing the best early-stage startups being built right here at USC.
This is your opportunity to get your foot in the door at the coolest companies in town. Come ready to talk about yourself! This also isn’t your grandpa’s career fair – feel free to dress formal, but expect business casual. Last but not least, don’t forget your resume. You’ll want to give it to recruiters, and we’ll have a place where you can drop your resume off and have it distributed for you to the companies in attendance.
Hosted by Spark SC

*** MICROSOFT SWAG PROVIDED***
ACM is starting a new weekly event series known as ACM Coding Space. The goal of this event is to provide a collaborative and social environment for any student who wants to get coding done, get help, or just relax.
Want to receive help for a tough CS class assignment? We’ll always have at least one mentor available who can help with CSCI 103, 104, 170, or 201! Want to prepare for coding interviews? We’ll have someone spend roughly 45 minutes teaching interview questions, with the topic of the questions rotating every week! Want a nice space to code with others? We’ll be providing refreshments while you can work with your friends or meet new people in GFS 118, with tons of whiteboard space!

The University of Southern California’s Vietnamese Student Association would like to invite you to the 38th Annual Vietnamese Culture Night: Grateful, Biết Ơn.
Date: Saturday, February 27th (doors open 5:30 pm, show starts at 6:00) Location: Bovard Auditorium at USC Admission is FREE. On campus parking is $10, but metered parking on any side streets is free after 8 pm!
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * About Us: The Vietnamese Student Association at USC is a cultural student organization that strives to provide an inclusive community for those of Vietnamese heritage and those interested in Vietnamese culture.
Each spring, our organization produces an annual culture show that is entirely student run and organized. Now in its 38th year, Vietnamese Culture Night serves as a platform for self-expression and exploration of issues affecting the Vietnamese American community. We hope that by sharing our stories with others we will be able create safe spaces for dialogue and understanding. VCN is produced by a diverse team of dedicated students who volunteer their time and talents to creating a show we hope you, the audience, will enjoy.
VSA puts on our yearly show without any dues/fees from our members. While the show is free, please consider donating to help us provide the best show possible for you: https://www.gofundme.com/uscvcn2016
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Our Story: Grateful, Biết Ơn
Grateful focuses on Joy, a college freshman at USC. After tragedy strikes, Joy attempts to explain her emotional experience and mental processes to others and to herself but fails, jeopardizing her support system. Vietnamese culture traditionally emphasizes problem solving within family lines, but for a loss of this magnitude, the Vietnamese community unites to assist the Le Family in their time of need.
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Performances by: • Xuan-Nghi Nguyen, Beverly Pham, Leo Xia • Co-ed Traditional Dance • Girls Traditional Dance • VSA Choir • VSA Modern Dance
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * For more updates, please follow us: Website: http://uscvsa.com/ Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/uscvsa/ Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/uscvsa Instagram and Snapchat: @uscvsa
If you have any questions, please feel free to post here or contact: Co-Presidents: Phoonie Ngo and Teresa Pham Co-Directors: Jamie Nguyen and Maitlyn Phan Co-Producers: Jennie Lam and Lily Hoang
USC VSA's 38th Annual Vietnamese Culture Night: Grateful

It's time for VRSC'S long awaited VR Unity Tutorial! Tonight, we'll be hosting the superdope Max Pittsley from the team of award-winning VR game, Elementerra! He'll be guiding you through the process of of creating an interactive virtual reality experience, from basic design principles to actually implementing your ideas in the Unity Game Engine. So come on down, enjoy the tutorial, have some free food, and get ready to create something awesome!

Request a free ride to Gamepipe from anywhere around the USC campus! Request another ride to get home safely.

Fifth Dev Night! Unity VR Tutorial!

Midterms pulling you down? Need a pick me up? Come out to Trousdale from 10-2pm on Wednesday, the 24th to get some soul-rejuvenating cheese rolls and milk tea boba! The proceeds will be directed towards students who will be going on medical missions! Come out and support! :)
